video_title: SOFTWARE ENGINEERING INTERVIEW PROCESS ｜ This Is What Happens After You Apply
transcript: hello everybody my name is nya and i'm the black female engineer i provide content for new and aspiring software engineers and today we're going to be talking about what the software this was my experience so typically within two to five weeks is when i would hear back from a company i would hear back on whether i got you know an interview or whether i you know just didn't get the job within that time frame usually now just you know a little note over here don't be discouraged by seeing constant rejections for interviews y'all once i when i say once i mean just a few months ago when i was applying i got a rejection notification two hours after i had applied to that job i was like wow what could i have possibly said that this person was just like not this she is not the one boom so just remember that and just keep your head up but typically yes between two and five weeks is when i would hear back about some type of update now let's say i got an interview what how this typically looked was i would get an email from a recruiter asking me um for to validate certain information validate the location i was applying to or the location i live in just like things like that and so typically once i got this email i knew that i was being considered and they're just you know crossing their teeth and all of that one of two things happened i either would get asked for a very quick phone um conversation it's still an interview i tweeted everything like an interview like all of it but you know more of like a conversation about 15 to 20 minutes where the recruiter learns more about me and my background and i learned more about the you know opportunity either that or i would get sent a hacker ring challenge now what is hackering hacker inc is a resource that companies use to administer coding challenges to applicants it's the way that they try to assess um in applicant skill sets now you know i have my own opinions on technical interviews and things like that but yes that is how they typically went about that so one of these two things would happen so let's start with this round i get an email asking for availability for a 10 to 20 15 to 20 minute conversation i would then set up that meeting conversation slash interview with that interviewer via google you know calendar and all of that and when we would start talking it would be more you know behavioral in um in structure seeing where my background is learning more about my projects and my interests going forward those are typically the main three topics seeing my transition into software engineering because i had transitioned from a different career so hearing that story and then hearing about what tech stack um i prefer if i'm interested in learning more um and just like my learning style um and coding style and then what i am looking for in a company and so those are really the main three things they hit every single time now if they liked what they heard within a week of that i would get notice of if i can have a second interview slash of you know next really formal longer interview about 30 to 45 minutes up to an hour and so this interview would really dive into do i know definitions do i understand what oop is do i understand what agile development looks like or the software development life cycle really just proving that i know my stuff especially because i didn't get a computer science degree really them honing into that now if they liked what they heard there then i would be invited for a technical interview this technical interview would typically be a live interview where i would be given a challenge right on the spot something like i can't even think one something like you know loops and working with arrays and objects in javascript i typically would be able to pick at me i would get between one and two questions of this and then after that typically then it was it that was it and i would hear back from the company in about like a week to ten days after that so rare typically about four weeks for me to even hear back on that status of my application to begin with so overall it would be about an eight week process for that one job now let's say we go into the
